Open Science is like a buffet\*: take what you can and what benefits you now -- come back for more!

![](images/paste-437BF19E.png)

This overview highlights resources that are available for TU Delft researchers in their Open Science journey. Please see the [poster](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.6752865) for the full visual representation with the links embedded.

## Open Engagement

## Open Methods

-   [Electronic Lab Notebooks (RSpace/eLABjournal)](https://www.tudelft.nl/en/library/research-data-management/r/manage/electronic-lab-notebook)

-   [protocols.io](https://www.protocols.io/) ([PLOS](https://plos.org/open-science/open-methods/))

-   [Five keys to writing a reproducible lab protocol](https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-021-02428-3) (Baker 2021)

    -   Document as you go: consider how you share your method from day one

    -   Write less, show more: consider using videos (see for example the [Journal of Visualized Experiments](https://www.jove.com/))

    -   Link, template, standardise: by using Electronic Lab Notebooks

    -   Deposit and document reagents (see [RRIDs](https://scicrunch.org/resources))

    -   Communicate: platforms such as protocols.io allow for easier communication

## Open Evaluation

-   'Open science and education can play an important role in improving the quality of our work and stimulating the use of our knowledge and findings by others' -- [TU Delft Recognition & Rewards Perspective 2021 -- 2024](https://www.tudelft.nl/en/about-tu-delft/strategy/recognition-rewards-perspective)

-   The Dutch position paper [Room for everyone's talent](https://www.nwo.nl/sites/nwo/files/media-files/2019-Recognition-Rewards-Position-Paper_EN.pdf) aims to recognise a wider range of academic contributions

-   [Strategy Evaluation Protocol (SEP) -- 2021-2027](https://www.vsnu.nl/files/documenten/Domeinen/Onderzoek/SEP_2021-2027.pdf) has Open Science as a main assessment criteria
